file_content.text: Never even heard of Makeb. But... new planet, new people to work over.
We knew a woman who vacationed on Makeb. It's a tourist planet; why is the Empire here?
This station is running on minimal power to conceal its energy signature. Almost like the Empire doesn't want anyone to know it's here.
Suppose we linger on the station a while before descent? Have some breakfast before we're shot at.
Local transmissions are heavily encrypted. This station is hidden.
What do you think it would take to topple that thing?
Planetary-scale architecture. In another life, we'd spend hours on the grass, looking up.
I'd suggest moving quickly... and hoping they don't have snipers.
I will attempt to interfere with the outgoing transmissions. We may proceed with the devastation.
Weapons out. I promise to linger over the view later.
Oh, real nice planet we're on. It's like I'm six years old on Rattatak again....
Careful! We'd be... embarrassed to see our careers end under rubble.
How bracing. It appears the planet has some fight in it after all!
I'm alright. Bit shook up. Let's hope they built the gravity hook to last.
I estimate the groundquake epicenter at three hundred kilometers distant. We appear to have escaped the worst.
Okay, I'm a city girl, but--that's not a bad view. Spit over the side?
The air is thinner here, but it is clean. Taste it. Smell yesterday's rain. Our time is short.
Stroll a bit, take in the view. A bit of light exercise can take your mind off the end of civilization.
Our soldiers are dying across the galaxy. I'd love to show them this view. Just for a moment.
I do not like it here. The electromagnetic inference in the atmosphere is... displeasing.
Race you to the bridge. Let's slam this whole freaking ship down a Hutt's throat.
We're ready for the next assault. Let's hope the captain doesn't try to shake us off.
I think I prefer boarding actions on a starship. Less chance of being thrown off the side.
Marvelous design, really--what I wouldn't have given for a spy ship like this in the old days. Almost a pity to destroy it.
Enemies detected. They know that we have arrived.
Smoke, oil and burning metal... if you don't love that smell, you're not living!
Let's hope no one does the same to our escape vehicle, shall we?
Not the most elegant form of sabotage, is it? Still, sometimes expediency wins out.
I've always wanted to fly one of those things. That... particular ship won't be an option, I suppose.
The ship is now nonfunctional, but I find the patterns created by burning metal soothing. I suggest you avoid breathing the carcinogenic vapors.
I used to love spots like this. Smash in some faces, raid the wine cellar and invite a few friends... I miss the simple life, you know?
Solida Hesk certainly enjoys her creature comforts. We find the extravagance... not unpleasant, but perhaps inappropriate.
Makeb is place of great ceremony, Herald, but do not let gold and glory dazzle.
They say Makeb is a playground for the wealthy elite. Heiresses, bored investors... at last, a civilized world.
Nice enough station. Wonder why the guards look so worried.
I hear the people of Makeb could buy and sell the Outer Rim a dozen times over. Guess we'll find out.
Keylander Station, the "Gateway to Makeb." I hear the souvenirs are pricey.
Why so grand a place to live? Is not mesas beauty enough?
And right here, Jedi, is proof of why credits and influence aren't always a bad thing.
Huh. Security's built right into the architecture. Can you see it?
It takes guts to build a house that nice, right next to a drop that high.
Oh my goodness. Shalim's so lucky. Imagine waking up to that view every day.
Now here is beauty. Smell of soil and living things.
A world rich with civilization, and naturally, our travels take us into wilderness.
Stay sharp. Those rock formations? Sniper's paradise.
Defending this kind of terrain must be a nightmare. Only place to retreat is down.
I can see why tourists used to come here. Now there's just mercenaries. The war touches everything.
Herald, they strike from behind!
Jedi, I'm picking up--blast, they're here!
Ambush! Get down!
Enemies on our six!
Look out! Behind us!
Hmph. Would have more beauty as wilderness. But still, is full of prey and dangers.
What marvelous statuary. Inspired by the Great Manifest Period. Not that these thugs care.
Money. Power. Meant nothing once the Hutts made their move. Better fix it.
Now this is living. Just need to kick the Regulators around a little, and we're good to go.
We could never build cities like this at home. The Hutts don't deserve it.
We build and build. But we forget: The ground has jaws that gape.
Do you have any idea how bad a groundquake would have to be to cause this? "Extremely bad" barely covers it.
Quake ripped the city in half. Glad we weren't here for it.
Okay, now I get why Doctor Avesta is so worried. How long can Makeb survive quakes like this?
This was caused by one groundquake? Just one? We'd better hurry.
Ground crumbles under buildings, and Hutts build to escape. Is foolishness.
Well, naturally, the ark is gigantic; it was designed to ferry Hutts around.
We're hijacking that? Hope you brought a ladder.
Whoa. Imagine dropping your hydrospanner from the top of that thing.
Wait, where's the ark? I thought it... oh. Oh, wow.
Regulators have had teeth and claws drawn, Herald. Is good work done.
Excellent, now perhaps our friends at the ark can finish their work in peace.
Let's see how tough the Regulators are when they can't shove a blaster in someone's face.
Nice. Maybe the Regulators can throw rocks.
Good, that should keep the ark engineers safe. And annoy the Regulators.
Seems shame to chain mesas with light bridge. But, has its uses.
Now, that's a lovely light-bridge design. We're going to horrendously misuse it, aren't we?
Could have used those light bridges on Balmorra. Imps wouldn't have been able to resist.
Makeb's got some genius engineers, that's for sure. Let's see what that light bridge can do.
Oof. How could anyone walk on that light bridge every day? I'm feeling dizzy just looking at it.
Regulators lie, dishonor, destroy. No mercy, Herald--we break their spine.
I've had just about enough of these Regulators. Holiday, darling, want to help us teach them a lesson?
Impressive barge. Let's bring it down in flames.
Storm Carrier's perimeter is breached. They'll throw everything at us. Be ready!
The Regulators should be brought to justice for what they've done. Ready when you are, Master!
Ha. Finally, the Hutts make prey worthy of us!
So this is what isotope-5 is capable of. Worth investigating--if we can survive the next five minutes.
That droid looked a lot smaller on the holo....
Toborro set this thing on civilians? He dies. Painfully.
That stink... and the size of it. What have the Hutts done?
Have shielded landing pad, Herald. Should be no ambush from reinforcements.
There we go. The landing pad force fields are up and holding.
Landing pad force fields are up. For now. Hope the Hutts don't have a plan B.
Landing pad secured. Any Hutt reinforcements will have to sit and wait.
That should keep the Hutts and their reinforcements out.
All these weapons and they still can't stop us. I'm sure there's a proverb in there somewhere.
So this is what happens when you give scientists an unlimited budget and say: "Build whatever makes you feel safest."
Here is where they craft their mechanical beasts and foolishness. Is no sanctuary.
Look, Jedi! Oh, the credits that must have been lavished on research here.... Sorry, I have something in my eye.
Lots of tech, lots of toys. Watch your step.
Are too soft for points, Herald, but this prey can still confuse enemies.
That should keep these uncouth fellows occupied for a bit.
That should distract the enemy. Real work's still ahead.
That should give the bad guys something else to shoot at.
It's a shame to release them just to be shot at. But if they can help us save the whole planet....
To cut into heart of a world. Strange to think of.
Phew! Somebody's been overclocking those laser mechanics.
If we need to make anyone disappear, Jedi--Makeb's core, right there.
Yikes, I think the hair on the back of my neck is cooking.
We're so far up! Too bad, I really wanted to see what the heart of a planet looks like.
Have Toborro at bay, Herald. Only remaining is to burn out his lair.
The planet's being turned inside out, yet the despot's palace survives. Still believe there's justice in the galaxy, Jedi?
No chance of getting in by the front door. Better be discreet.
Let's hope Doctor Droidmaker really did build a secret entrance, or this is going to be a long siege.
Toborro's in there holding Makeb by the throat. And for what? He really must be insane.
Trinkets and foolishness. Cannot shield from death that comes.
So small things, these fuel rods, to be saving a world's people. Should bring to safety.
Herald, is more enemies coming! From barge overhead!
More old things. True history should live in heart and mind, not in gathering dust.
It would appear Toborro's sense of decor went the way of his sanity.
And there's our fuel rods. Mind how you go; if we drop them, the ark's not going anywhere.
Er, Jedi--that transport appears to be bringing some friends!
The barbarians are moving in, I see.
Whole place smells of crazy.
Last piece of the puzzle. Now we can get the ark out of here.
Heavy carrier coming in! Bringing reinforcements!
Rather be saving lives than artifacts. But, the past's worth keeping.
Remember, this guy's nuts. No telling what he could try.
Perfect. Now we just need to make it out alive, and we've got one fully fueled ark.
Heads up! Whatever that is, it's dropping more reinforcements!
I guess when thugs are destroying a planet, raiding a library suddenly doesn't seem as bad.
He surrounds himself with beauty, but all I can feel here is madness and rage.
Hmm. I thought the fuel rods would be bigger. I hope there's enough to fuel the whole ark.
Overhead! More mercenaries are coming in!
This is a good lesson, I suppose. What civilization comes to, if anarchy goes unstopped.
T7 = dislikes orbital stations // Reason = too many stairs
I remember the Empire's orbital stations. They're about as sterile as ours.
Ugh, forgot the extra kolto. They'll have the shops open, right?
Makeb is a vacation spot. Never thought the war would bring us here.
Your orbital stations remind me of the Empire. Calm, orderly.
Shalim's plantation = beautiful // Hutts = don't deserve Makeb
Remember that vacation you've been promising? Can it start now?
We should see what the Hutts have been up to at the pool. Or the casinos....
Hmm. Needs more turrets.
Beauty and wealth. A prime target for the Hutts.
Rough terrain ahead // T7 = switching to all-wheel drive
Nice view. Kinda makes you homesick for Tython.
Ugh, nature. Give me Nar Shaddaa any day.
Plenty of cover. Poor visibility, though.
A petting zoo, compared to the jungles of Dromund Kaas.
Regulators = incoming // T7 = charging combat implants
Guess they're on to us now!
Hey! We're trying to make a call here!
Halt, Regulator scum!
Dispatch them quickly, Jedi. The scientist is waiting.
Talaos City = infested // Jedi + T7 = drive Regulators out
Nice fountain. Except for all the scum standing around it.
There's our welcome party. I can smell 'em from here.
We could flank them... or take them head-on... your call, of course.
There will be civilians among this rabble. We should be cautious.
If Jedi = falls in trench // T7 = will attempt to extract!
Ouch. Hope nobody was home when that happened.
I really should have brought more kolto.
A grave for the Regulators. Only joking, Master Jedi.
Nothing can match the power of nature--though a true Sith comes close.
Ark = must require many astromech units
What do you think powers that thing? Live Jedi?
You know our sad, boring little freighter? I'm thinkin' it's time to upgrade.
Still not big enough for the Hutts.
A class-zero launch engine. It has been centuries since I saw such methods.
Weapons = destroyed // Regulators = halted // Ark = not safe yet
That ought to slow them down... until they find bigger guns.
Boom! Let's see 'em take that ark now!
Regulator weapons destroyed. Objective achieved.
A pity we could not have stockpiled these. I suspect our fight will not end here.
Light bridge = very high // T7 = pities Hutt droids
If we got enough lightsabers, I bet we could make one of those.
There's the light bridge. Have I mentioned I'm afraid of heights?
Attractive design, cheap construction. No wonder the Hutts like them.
Only the Hutts would construct such an easily eliminated passage.
T7 = recalibrating motion sensors for increased altitude // Recalibration = complete
All right, we're on. Now let's find the reactors and blow the place up.
This thing doesn't seem so big once you're on it. Just as high, though.
Maintain awareness. This is no pleasure barge.
A defensible transport. Mercenaries do make useful things from time to time.
Droid = fueled by isotope-5 // Jedi + T7 = avoid hitting power cells
That's one of the isotope-5 droids. Kinda cute for a super-fueled death machine.
So this is an isotope-5 droid. Let's get a look at it... okay, enough looking!
An isotope-5 droid. Approach with caution.
I recognize this creature from the hologram. Toborro's droid.
Hutt reinforcements = blocked // Jedi + T7 = victorious!
Let's see 'em get through that. Would it be wrong to laugh when they try?
Suddenly I feel a little claustrophobic. Let's get moving, huh?
A clever utilization of force field technology. Noted for future reference.
The barrier has bought us some time. We should use it wisely.
Native Makeb creatures = should be rescued too // Jedi = ask if ark has room?
I like zoos. Not so much mad science labs. Maybe someday we'll visit one that's under control.
Sure you want to be in here? There are a few too many things for us to be killed by.
Not much of a sanctuary anymore. If it ever was.
The heart of the Hutts' terrible science. It will burn.
Creatures = lucky to be free // Hutt forces = not so lucky
Look at 'em run. I almost feel bad. Wait--no, I don't.
Nice to watch someone else fight the beasties, for a change.
An unorthodox solution. Ought to keep the Hutts busy, though.
Primal instinct at work. A joy to behold.
Jedi + T7 = must move quickly // Makeb = rapidly destabilizing
Look at the size of this thing. No wonder Makeb is falling apart.
I've worked with laser scalpels before. Never this big.
Diabolical. We can't let the Hutts get away with this, sir.
If such power could be used from orbit... a thought for another time.
T7 = glad palace damaged // Toborro = deserves worse!
Even militarized Hutts can't resist a good palace.
Not a bad-looking place. Little crooked, maybe.
Form over function. The hallmark of a Hutt.
Don't let this facade fool you. Toborro's strongest forces await us inside.
T7 = glad Jedi has taste // Toborro = has none
All this, while Makeb gets destroyed. Makes you mad enough to... meditate, I guess.
See, Toborro's just your average Hutt. Wallowing in luxury, ignoring the peons outside.
More decor than defenses. The odds are in our favor.
A gaudy, useless display. Even the Dark Council does not indulge in such excess.
Ark + fuel rods = people of Makeb saved!
Whatcha got there, Kira? Oh, nothing, just fuel for the ark that will save Makeb.
Careful with those fuel rods. Wouldn't want you to explode or anything.
We've exceeded mission parameters. Enough fuel here to power ten arks.
We should deliver these fuel rods quickly. Makeb does not have long.
T7 = scanning transport // Transport = carrying many Regulators
Are you seeing this thing? The transport that's blocking out the sun?
Now that's a transport. These mercs don't do anything subtle, do they?
A troop transport. We should expect major resistance ahead.
Some kind of transport. Carrying more Regulators, no doubt.
Archives = many tetrabytes of data // Jedi + T7 = must recover
Really? The groundquakes weren't enough?
Never much of a historian, myself. Not that I condone this.
The people of Makeb should've secured their secrets elsewhere. Not in a museum.
How quickly history can be destroyed.
I visited this station years ago. It has moved far from the planet it serves. Interesting.
Space stations--so ugly. Give me fresh air and sky!
I've heard Makeb hired some top-flight mercenaries to protect the planet. Don't see any here.
We're going to Makeb? This is gonna be great! It was voted the number one vacation destination in last year's HoloNet survey!
I laid low on Makeb after a job a few years back. Beautiful planet. The ride down from here is a thrill.
Checklist: Servomotors oiled, weapons primed, deletion techniques updated. Bring on the troublemakers!
No wonder the Hutts conquered Makeb. The mesas are too open for effective defense.
Trees! Places to climb! Fresh air! Just what Bowdaar needed.
Wow, look at that view! You suppose those pillars are natural formations?
Captain, when this mission is over, we really need to spend some time here. Months, maybe.
It's about time we visited a nice planet. It's always more fun to shoot people in pleasant scenery.
Advice: Sheer drops offer a highly effective method of deleting troublemakers, Master.
Pathetic fortifications. Shalim's fighters are amateurs.
These tress are too short for good climbing. Also, I would be shot.
This landing zone's hot, Captain. Better keep our heads down.
Look at those floaty things! I bet we could ride one like a balloon!
Snipers could have a field day here. Good thing I am one.
Anticipation: Sensors detect over three dozen potential troublemakers within a kilometer of our coordinates!
Regulators incoming!
Enemy reinforcements!
Captain, watch out!
Ambush! Ambush!
Here they come!
Warning: Ambush!
An urban combat zone--my favorite kind.
Do not break beautiful cities. It's bad luck.
You suppose any of these people realize how much trouble they're in?
Would you look at this place? It's a looter's paradise.
Nice town. Too bad we have to put holes in it.
Anticipation: The city's population appears to be primarily troublemakers, Master. How wonderful!
There's no greater destructive force than nature itself.
Do not linger. The next quake could close these walls on us.
Groundquakes did a number on this place. I'm surprised more folks didn't get hurt.
Ouch--what a crack. On the bright side, the city's really opened up to new development.
I'd hate to be in charge of redrawing the street maps here.
Regret: I have never had the pleasure of deleting an entire city neighborhood, Master. Someday... someday....
Only Hutts would build something this large that only serves one purpose.
Is the ark supposed to look like that?
That must be the ark, Captain. Bet you could cram Talaos City into it.
So this is the ark? It must have engines on its engines.
Whatever the Hutts are getting out of Makeb, must be worth spending a fortune on this ark.
Analysis: This is either the ark, or an enormous practical joke. Potentially both.
That's the last of the Regulator stockpiles. They can't retake the ark from here.
Now the Regulators have no teeth.
We did it! Without all their fancy hardware, the Regulators are just another bunch of bucketheads.
That's the last of it. If the Regulators didn't hate us before, they sure do now.
All done. Imagine how rich we'd be if we'd sold that hardware instead of destroying it.
Confirmation: Mission objectives have been met, Master. The Regulators are now forty percent less combat effective.
That's where the enemy will make its crossing.
Bridges made of light aren't safe. Why do people here use them?
I get nervous every time we cross a light bridge. After this, it'll be even worse.
I really hope nobody tries this dirty trick with the light bridge on us. I hate poetic justice.
When we drop that army off the light bridge, nobody will ever want to use those things again.
Observation: This platform provides an excellent vantage point for witnessing the impending carnage at the light bridge, Master.
An impressive battle platform. It will look beautiful going down in flames.
The Storm Carrier will not save the Regulators--not while you and Bowdaar live!
The bigger they are, the louder they explode. Let's do this, Captain.
Why do they call it the Storm Carrier? Are there high winds in the cargo hold?
Have to hand it to the Regulators--they spared no expense on this thing.
Announcement: I am disabling collateral damage restraint protocols while aboard the Storm Carrier, Master!
We won't last long against this droid--strike hard and fast!
Bowdaar's fur is standing up straight. What powers this droid?
Hello, ugly droid! We're here to smash you--don't take it personally!
Look at that blasted droid! This is going to hurt, isn't it?
This droid looks like it could fight us all day! Let's not do that!
Request: Please investigate installing an isotope-5 power upgrade in me when this is over, Master!
The platform is secured.
No more Hutt reinforcements will be landing here.
That'll keep Toborro's people out for a while.
Toborro won't be landing anyone here.
Any Hutt forces that try to land here are in for a nasty surprise.
Alert: This platform is now secured against unauthorized landings by Hutt troublemakers. Most disappointing.
I see no sanctuary here--for us, or the enemy.
Pathways to battle in all directions. I like this Sanctuary.
This Sanctuary place looks like all kinds of trouble.
Why do all the deadliest places have such happy names? "Sanctuary"--right!
I'm betting this place was named Sanctuary for the irony.
Information: My long-range sensors indicate we will not run out of troublemakers to delete in the Sanctuary. Hooray, Master.
Unpredictable diversions are the best kind.
The beasts are free to devour their tormentors. Bowdaar approves.
They're free. Let's hope these critters don't come back to bite us on the rear--literally.
Go, beasties! Shoo! Go eat the Hutt minions!
I do love a good distraction. Hope those things keep Toborro's forces busy.
Confession: Few things are more pleasing to my sensors than natural predators running amok.
This drill is carving straight through the planet. We need to turn it off.
This drill will destroy Makeb unless we stop it!
Be careful, Captain--who knows how much power this thing puts out.
Whew! I'd hate to be on the receiving end of this thing's laser. Where's the "off" switch?
Quite an operation Toborro has here. Let's shut it down, shall we?
Opinion: What an entertaining method for deleting troublesome rocks and soil. Gives me ideas, Master.
Let's get inside that palace and find Toborro before this mesa collapses.
Toborro is somewhere inside that palace. He will pay for what he's done!
That's Toborro's palace, huh? Good thing I packed extra ammo.
That's where Toborro lives? I bet parties there are incredible!
I don't want to be inside that palace when the next quake levels this mesa. C'mon....
Analysis: This mesa has already suffered significant damage, Master. We should find Toborro quickly.
Look at this room... Toborro must be trying to distract us with bad taste.
I smell a Hutt close by. Be ready, Captain.
Look at this place. You just know Toborro overspent on all this junk.
Hope we have time to loot this place. My ship quarters need sprucing up.
Judging by the tasteless decor, we're in Toborro's main room.
Trivia: I estimate this room alone cost over thirteen million credits to construct and decorate.
We have the isotope-5 fuel rods. The ark will fly.
We should take these isotope-5 fuel rods to Shalim. The ark needs them.
With these fuel rods, that ark can finally get off the ground.
Who's going to carry the fuel rods back to the ark? Just wondering if I need to take my anti-radiation pills.
We have the ark's fuel rods. Let's get out of here.
Assertion: These are the isotope-5 fuel rods that will power the ark. Mission accomplished, Master.
That's a Regulator heavy transport overhead.
The Regulators travel in a flying fortress.
I'm betting that transport is crawling with Regulators. I'm starting to hate those guys.
Boy, the Regulators know how to get around in style. Look at that thing.
Good thing for us that Regulator transport isn't outfitted for surface bombardment.
Identification: The vessel flying overhead is a heavy troop transport used by the Regulators.
Rescuing a museum. Now I have done everything.
If Makeb must die, its legacy will survive.
Let's get what we came for. Don't want to be trapped in a museum when another quake hits.
Every time I enter a museum, it reminds me of Jedi training.
You rescue Makeb's culture. I'll liberate the valuables.
Observation: Organics should outfit themselves with data encoders and store their historical records internally. It's simply more efficient.
Analysis: The Empire maintains a minimal presence here, master. I suspect our mission will be a secret one.
Speculation: Given Makeb's unstable atmosphere, many construction workers likely perished building that gravity hook.
Alert: At the risk of stating the obvious, master, this mesa is tectonically unstable. Be careful.
Hypothetical: Combined with a weapon of adequate range, my line of sight from this vantage point would afford unlimited targets.
Hint: The vessel's defenders are preparing to engage us. Calculating targets for maximum liquidation.
Praise: An impressive liquidation, master. I am proud of you.
Reassurance: I have calculated the precise demolition points to bring down this structure, master. I'll require three tonnes of detonite.
Alert: Liquidation protocols set to "armor-piercing"!
Declaration: Invader vehicles have been disabled with maximum efficiency.
Promise: I will endeavor not to liquidate everyone, master. I'll leave some for you.
Reminder: Heat shields would be a welcome addition to my chassis, master.
Rumination: One must admire the ingenuity on display here. Sadly, it will not save the enemy.
Information: This droid has a unique power signature. Cataloging it as isotope-5, master.
Report: Mining operations have been re-engaged, master.
Remark: A most impressive hole in the ground, master. Truly, Makeb is a planet of wonders.
Extrapolation: Clearly, Makeb's organics do not fear heights.
Query: A groundquake has divided our path--do we take the high road, or the low?
Cheer: Flying undesirable liquidated!
Approval: The Archon's defenses have been weakened by groundquakes, master. Let us proceed with his liquidation!
Reassurance: The Archon's home furnishings are intended to intimidate organics, master. I remain undeterred!
Blizz think this space-place not very busy. Maybe all Empire-people like planet so much they not want to leave!
Ah, Makeb. I retired here once. Spent a year in the resorts before the crown prince of Alderaan noticed he'd mysteriously spent a hundred million credits on vacation.
Wow, it's so quiet here. I'm picking up next to nothing on my link, what I do get is so heavily encrypted I think I gained ten kilos.
Hmph, seen one of these, seen ten. When we gonna see a place worth trashin'?
Checked, Makeb. Not my kind of vacation spot, but the wildlife's something to see.
Master, I've collated a list of five-star resorts on Makeb should you wish to establish an itinerary. The first three thousand seem especially nice.
Ooh... Boss going to climb sky-thing? Blizz want to ride!
Please tell me we aren't riding in that thing; the music's terrible.
Oh wow, it just keeps going and going. Have you ever seen anything like that?
Ain't seen nothin' that tall since Coruscant. Bet it'd snap like a twig if we gave it a little shake.
Doesn't look fortified. Great field of fire, though.
Ahh! Boss! Help! Blizz feel ground move! Blizz make it angry?
Ugh. For a "groundquake," there seems to be an awful lot of sky falling.
Whoa...! I'm okay. I'm okay. Freaked out, but okay....
Hah, now that's what I call shakin' the place up! This dump ain't so bad.
Reminds me of home. Geonosis used to rock me to sleep.
Aww... Blizz think Blizz see-scope get busted in rock fall.
I'd watch where you admire the view, with the way things have been shaking around.
I wish someone could take our picture. I'll just paste us in later.
Shoulda drug some of those runty mercs up here and seen who could toss one farther.
Phew, shoulda brought my rifle.
Wee! How come we never ride boss's ship from outside?
Try not to get too cavalier out here. You're the only one with flight rockets, remember?
I hope you're going to let me tap into this thing before we crash it.
How you figurin' we get in? Punch a hole, or jump on the roof 'til some chump pops his head out?
Good fight and a cool breeze. Can't ask much more.
Why boss go and blow up good parts?
Landing pads are for droids and amateurs. Ever park a shuttle on the roof of a Hutt barge? They hate that.
You made sure nobody was in that, right? Kidding!
Ever made a swoop punk watch his ride burn? Never gets old.
Didn't put up much fight, did they?
Oh, pretty! Remind Blizz of Anchorhead with more paint! Less sand, too.
The owner should have a word with the groundskeepers. The view was a little more... even last time I lived here.
When I finally quit the bounty business, I want to live in a place like this. Well, without the ecological devastation.
White's my favorite color. Nothin' shows a good smash up like white.
Fancy. Think it's all show?
Um, boss see big noisy box speeder?
I'd like to take this moment to remind you that you are not, in fact, a hovertank--no matter how much you dress like one.
Maybe I'm alone in this, but I have no idea how you fight a hovertank....
Now that's what I'm talkin' about! Time to take this can for a joy ride!
Nice hardware. No Basilisk, but nice.
Big box speeders not so tough. Blizz prefer sandcrawler.
This is going right to the top of my "stupid ideas that actually worked" list.
Hey! Take my picture on top of one of these!
Hmph, still say we shoulda stole one.
Decent memento. Think I'll frame it.
Um, boss. Blizz think cantina closed.
A cantina. What say we drink to Makeb?
That scanner you picked up seems to think this is the place. Have a look?
Wouldn't be caught dead in this froufrou-lookin' dump.
Movement. If it's our mark, he's not alone.
Ooo! Boss, rock-river! See!
Funny, a Hutt once told me to visit a place like this when I died.
Wow, it's hot in here. What I'd give for one of those heat resistors Blizz was playing with.
Workin' a sweat yet, runt? Cute little sauna we got here.
Proof life can adapt to anything.
Boss let Blizz see how shiny floor work?
I'd make some crack about a light bridge being shaky ground, but given the rest of Makeb....
I was reading up on this light bridge tech, it's really fascinating. Sturdier than conventional materials too, unless you have a power outage.... Let's hurry.
Come on, I don't trust nothin' flimsy enough to see through.
There's our base. Give a knock?
Ooh! Krayt-droid! Boss! Boss! Can Blizz keep?
I see the Hutt taste in droids matches their taste in food: overdone.
It looks like something out of one of my bad holovids. You know, where a droid tramples a city?
That it? Gonna whip this overgrown dumpster with one arm behind my back.
Never been a fan of droids. No mandokar.
Blizz think boss got it working now!
We're really going down there, aren't we? Whatever they're paying us, it ain't enough.
Now we just hop down to the middle of a highly unstable planet on the brink of tearing itself to pieces. Piece of cake, right?
You done muckin' with that thing yet? Itchin' to gut a couple more of these critters.
Finally found a nice vacation spot.
Big machine dig this hole? Blizz want to try!
Well, no one ever accused mining conglomerates of finesse.
This plan was scary enough without all the frenzied subterranean monsters.
Hope you ain't afraid of heights, runt.
Corridan's never going to believe this.
Um, boss... what "atomization hazard" mean?
If the Imperials ever do manage to get their hands on this isotope-5 stuff, we had better see a cut.
These mining platforms are scary stuff; they're basically giant disruptors.
How 'bout we set off some real fireworks? Flip the switch on this bad boy, and let's crack this sorry rock in two.
Beats a shovel, that's for sure.
This give Blizz idea for stretchy road, even be soft on feet!
That's one way to change a traffic pattern.
Watch your step around here; I don't want to find a sinkhole the hard way.
This ain't nothin'. Ever seen a city block drop out of the sky? More fun when you're on it.
Mind rockslides.
Kaboom! Good shot, boss!
I could've dodged that easy. What? I could.
Nice shot! You make it look easy!
Watch that flyer pop.
One down.
Sorry, boss. Blizz not have trusty field-frequency tuner....
I don't suppose we have time to sneak in as delivery people?
I get the feeling the Archon isn't keen on visitors.
Pff. It'll take more than this to keep me from killin' another Hutt.
Gardens in a fort. Sad.
Blizz kind of scared of machines here, boss. We go soon?
If you ever wondered why I spend so much time planning my exits, it's to avoid winding up in a place like this.
I don't get how anyone could use these on another living thing. Just disgusting.
Could get some use outta this place, better believe it.
Another reason to die fighting.
I hear the shuttle ride can get a bit bumpy. Wish we were taking the Thunderclap.
Antivirals... check. Tropical antibacterials... check. Antivenoms... check....
Soon, this station's halls will resound with the cheers of a Republic victory!
I hate these stations. Never a decent bar.
Fear and concern permeate every seal and bolt around us. We must bring harmony.
All right. The view was worth the ride down.
Someday, I hope we can come to places like this without blasters in hand.
This beautiful planet will not suffer the depredations of the Hutts for long! Havoc Squad is here!
Can't blame the Hutts for moving in. Got half a mind to stay myself.
There is beauty here, but only in the eyes. This is a place of turmoil, not splendor.
Perfect terrain for snipers. Keep an eye out.
Poisonous plants and animals are common in wilderness like this. Stay on your guard.
Uneven terrain detected--weapon stabilizers at maximum!
Blowing up rocks and trees is never as satisfying as taking down a big, fancy building.
Whether in trees and rocks, or cities and structures, a path can always be found.
Hostiles! Look out!
Sir! Enemy contacts!
Enemy scum detected!
Regulators! It's an ambush!
We are under attack!
Gotta watch those corners--enemy could be hiding anywhere.
I hope we can get relief workers in to help these civilians soon.
Engaging urban combat protocols!
Hmph. Place is a wreck. Might be some valuables scattered around, at least....
Yuun perceives great hostility hidden within these stones. We should be cautious.
Looks like Lemda was right about these groundquakes.
I hate to think of the civilian casualties from a quake powerful enough to do this.
I have no doubt that the Republic's expert engineers can repair even damage this extensive!
Pff. I've put bigger holes in stuff than that.
This world tears at itself in fury at the unrest marring its surface.
I was expecting big, but that's... big.
So this is the ark. The Hutts really have been busy.
The Hutts build large, but do they build as well as the Republic's noble shipwrights? I think not!
Wow. How much do you think we could sell that for on the Nar Shaddaa ship markets?
The ark. Its scale is impressive, but many design flaws are immediately evident.
Regulators ought to have a hard time without any heavy weapon support.
That's the last of the Regulators' assets. The ark engineers should be safer now.
The weapons of our enemies lie crushed beneath the heel of freedom!
Let's see if the Regulators still want to play now that we've smashed all their toys.
If only the enemy's aggressive intentions were as easily destroyed as their weapons.
All right--let's hope those droids can't fly.
These light bridges hardly seem ideal for daily use.
The enemies of the Republic march to their own destruction!
This will be the first bridge I've ever taken out without using any explosives.
In one stroke, we turn our enemy's march of aggression into a swift defeat.
Got you covered, sir. Let's move.
The enemy could have anything aboard this ship. We should stay alert.
We strike now into the very heart of our enemies! For the Republic!
Think we could get one of these for our missions?
This warship's design is elegant, if vicious. The embodiment of violence.
One of the isotope-5 droids--time to see how tough they really are.
An isotope-5 droid... ready to engage on your command.
Let the Hutts' shoddy design face the ultimate in Republic combat engineering!
Looks a bit bigger in person, boss. This could get hairy.
This droid appears no different from its makers--powerful and indiscriminately violent.
All right, we're secure.
This force field should hold the enemy back for the time being.
Landing pad secured--ready to proceed!
That ought to keep Toborro's goons off us for a while.
The force field's integrity is pristine--we may proceed without further interruption.
What in blazes are they doing in this place?
I hate to imagine what sort of "research" has been going on here.
No "sanctuary" could hide the enemies of freedom from us!
Wonder if any of the critters here are endangered? Probably be worth something.
Technologies and biologies have been twisted to unnatural purposes here.
If that's not a good diversion, I don't know what is.
That should keep the enemy busy enough for us to proceed.
Embrace freedom, noble creatures! Strike back at those who held you in chains!
Wish I could see the looks on those idiots' faces when their little pets come after them.
Every creature must find its own path to contentment.
They're cutting straight into Makeb's core... no wonder this place is breaking apart.
What were the Hutts thinking? They had to know the damage something like this would do....
We must disable this crude device before Makeb is utterly destroyed!
Think we could strap one of these babies to our ship?
Such tremendous power... Yuun has seen nothing like it since the Gauntlet....
This must be it. Let's get in and get what we need before it's too late.
The Hutt lives like this while the planet collapses around him.
We've found the despot's lair! Eradication protocols engaged!
Place this nice is just begging for a few tactical warheads.
There are no signs or markings to call this place home. It is a lair of evil, nothing more.
Wow. Who pays real credits for this junk?
With all of these baubles, Toborro can't be far.
We should melt these extravagances down to forge a statue commemorating our imminent victory!
What? I'm still right here. Not looting anything. Not one thing.
These objects point the way to their cruel master. Toborro is near.
We've got what we came for--let's move!
We should get these fuel rods back to the ark immediately, sir.
Victory is ours! Let us return to the ark for its triumphant first flight!
You grab the fuel rods, I'll just make one final sweep for... enemies....
Our time is short. These fuel rods must be returned to the ark at once.
Enemy reinforcements incoming!
That transport! More enemy forces!
More enemy forces overhead! Activating additional targeting routines!
Looks like these guys have friends with air support, boss.
The vessel above brings renewed hostilities!
Guess collateral damage isn't a problem for the Hutts' people.
How would anyone target an archive? It's despicable.
Analyzing blast marks to estimate enemy armament, sir!
This is just downright sloppy work.
Yuun cannot comprehend our enemies' motives. To collect assets, yes. To destroy history, no.
Hijacked a few ships over Makeb in my time--mining barges, luxury cruises. Even had a couple run-ins with local security. Hope no one here recognizes me.
Never thought our travels would take us to a planet like Makeb. Not that I'm complaining.
Makeb--a planet of corporate excess and overpriced tourism. What's the Empire's interest here?
The soldiers here are tense. I would know the reason.
I always wanted to visit Makeb--purely for pleasure, mind you. The planet's civilization is far too young to have any archaeological merit.
These space stations are dead places. Nothing but metal and darkness.
That must be the gravity hook. Not exactly subtle.
And I thought the mesas were tall. Amazing.
Impressive. Note how the architecture complements the planet's natural landscape. Makeb's builders are nothing if not precise.
This is nothing. I tore down buildings twice as high on Yn.
Look at the size of that!
There could be many eyes up there, watching us. We should move quickly.
You think this is bad? Try piloting a busted gully jumper through a hurricane on Poderis. Rattle the teeth right outta your head.
That can't be good.
For all its beauty, Makeb isn't exactly hospitable.
This planet thrashes like a wounded animal.
Steady, there!
The world trembles at your passing, lord.
Wow, a view like this, really makes a guy contemplate his place in the galaxy and--yeah, okay, I'm messing with ya. Let's go kill something, huh.
It's so beautiful up here. Peaceful. You can almost forget everything happening below.
I think I'm beginning to understand the planet's appeal.
A long fall to the ground.
Oh my. We are... quite high, aren't we?
Mind the edge, lord. Ambition may yet surpass reason.
This ship's not gonna crash itself. Let's get to work, yeah?
Careful. One wrong step and it's all over.
Whatever happens, let's try to be elsewhere when this ship goes down.
Let us send this ship screaming to the ground below.
Ugh. The sooner we're back on solid ground, the better.
Our enemies know we are here. Let us end this.
Waste of a good ship, you ask me.
That takes care of the landing pad. Let's go find Solida Hesk.
No place for Solida Hesk to run to now. We may take her at our leisure.
Now there is no escape.
I confess I'm starting to see the appeal in vandalism.
No way off, no hope of rescue. The trap is set.
Nice digs. Always saw myself retiring in a place like this.
Solida Hesk seems to be doing well for herself. No doubt she earned every credit legally.
The people of Makeb build their homes pretty enough, but their estates lack the grandeur and majesty one finds on Dromund Kaas.
I have seen palaces smaller than this. Does this Solida Hesk think herself a queen?
I do hope Solida Hesk is home. Would be a shame to come all this way for nothing.
This is no stronghold. A child could break these walls.
This would be so much easier strapped behind a good starfighter.
We've got to take out those hovertanks!
I hope you're not planning to fight those things head-on?
The Hutts bring toys to war.
And I thought those hoversleds the Hutts always used were big.
On Kalee, I hunted beasts as tall as ten men. These tanks do not frighten me.
The hovertanks are scrap. Riot!
We've given the rebels a fighting chance. The rest is up to them.
That's the last of them.
We have crushed the Hutts' toys.
Well done, my lord!
A glorious battle, lord.
Looks like it's a cantina, closed for business. Hope they kept some of the good stuff inside.
Looks like this is the place.
Our quarry must be in there.
A crumbling hole to hide in.
Readings indicate our man is inside.
Our hunt ends here.
And I thought Tatooine was hot.
Master Ryen once taught me an exercise to ward off the heat. I still can't do it without thinking of him.
I suggest we not linger. Collapsing worlds and lava do not mix well.
The planet bleeds.
Cripes, but it's hot! I'll wager no Hutt's dared venture down here.
The heat is good. Ignites an inferno in the spirit.
The light show is nice and all, but honestly, some basic durasteel would be a lot simpler.
Beautiful technology. I wonder why we don't see many bridges like this off Makeb?
Fortunate that the bridge is still up. Let's not push our luck.
The enemy's stronghold lies at the other side.
These light bridges--they've never been known to short out... have they?
I am ready for whatever lies across.
Tell me that thing has a weak spot.
Careful, we don't know what this droid is capable of.
The Hutts know how to build a death machine, I'll give them that.
A machine is no match for the conqueror of Yn and Chabosh!
Well, there go any doubts I had about isotope-5's potency....
Now we see which is stronger--Hutt science or Sith instinct.
Now comes the fun part.
I think that did it.
The power appears to be back online.
Into the abyss.
And down we go! This is just like that excavation on Krayiss--without the insane Force apparitions, of course.
The way is open.
If I know the Hutts, there's more than a few bodies lying at the bottom of that hole.
The miners were toying with forces beyond their control, digging like this.
I didn't think the Hutts could one-up their work on Varl. Clearly, I was wrong.
The mouth of oblivion.
I've operated my fair share of drills, at excavation sites and so forth. But this--this dwarfs anything I've seen.
The miners pierced the planet's heart. They were surprised the blow was fatal?
Heh, wish Talos was here. Guy's terrified of heights. Probably dangle him from the edge, watch him squirm.
Given everything that's happened, the Hutts can't still be drilling, can they?
I'd like to see some of this isotope-5 for myself. Finally see what all the fuss is about.
The Hutts know nothing of conquest. Only annihilation.
Just a fraction of the operating costs here would have financed my excavations for a decade!
The Hutts have killed a planet. Impressive.
Ouch. Glad I wasn't here when this happened.
This devastation... it's just awful. I hope everyone made it out safely.
This planet is crumbling before our very eyes. It can't be long now.
Another wound in a dying planet.
The Hutts have a long history of ruining planets, but they've never been as... thorough as they've been here.
Such destruction. Such power. If only you could harness it.
You're a natural. Now, try it with your eyes closed.
Got him!
How gratifying.
Burn, little fighter.
Hah, very good, my lord!
Perhaps the next one will provide better sport.
Place looks like a fortress. Won't be easy.
Let's end this.
It appears the Hutt isn't taking visitors. No matter.
Walls of light will not hold me back.
The place looks well guarded. But if history has proven one thing, it's that no stronghold is impenetrable.
The Archon must be hiding in there. Pity the Hutts can't run.
This room brings back some bad memories. Take it from me, the Hutts have some pretty twisted pastimes.
Terrible things have happened in this place.
Oh look, we found the Archon's recreation room. Charming.
This place reeks of death.
The Hutts are masters at dispensing pain and torment. I shudder to think what went on here.
Either you kill your enemy, or he kills you. There is no honor in prolonging death.
We don't know Makeb, but we follow Sith clan to the ends of the galaxy.
Makeb, vacation hot spot for Alderaan's petty nobles. Maybe I'll get lucky and run into an old acquaintance.
Master, everyone on this station is flooded with apprehension. It's as if they're holding their breath.
Quiet chatter, light station traffic, encrypted comms. Sure sign of a covert op.
I pulled Makeb's tourism profile, my lord. The resort prices are staggering, far above a captain's salary.
Ugh, Imperial stations are so stuffy. Can't wait to hit Makeb's resorts and take in some sights.
We feel the Hutt clan's eyes. Sith must keep moving.
The planet roars with the Sith clan.
Our claws belong on the ground.
The hull is weak. Sith clan must carve its way inside!
The flames of battle cleanse us.
We paint the Hesk palace with a new shade of crimson.
The shell is strong, but the meat inside is soft.
Hovertanks shatter under the Sith clan's fist!
The scent leads inside.
We are not meant for such heat.
We charge to the stronghold!
We rend the Hutt droid to scraps!
Our hunt leads deeper into Makeb.
The enemy cracks open the planet.
We smell burning ozone.
The planet tears itself apart.
Sith clan revels in a fiery kill!
Force fields don't block our hunt!
The Hutt questions when he should kill.
So that's the gravity hook. I've seen bigger.
How exciting! Even the planet seeks to destroy us.
Now that's a long fall. Shame we didn't keep any mercenaries around to march over the precipice.
Finally, no more hiding. Let's fill this ship with the screams of our enemies.
Pity someone wasn't inside. But a girl can dream, can't she?
No red carpet? Someone needs to teach Solida Hesk some manners.
Pathetic machines. I'll litter the battlefield with their wreckage.
No more hovertanks? Pity. My lightsaber was just warming up.
End of the line. This spy better be grateful.
The fires burn fiercely, master. But they run cold compared to my rage.
A few meters below us lies an agonizing, fiery death. How invigorating!
Is this monstrous scrap heap supposed to frighten me?
That woke the mining equipment. Now, let us burrow deeper into this dying planet.
How lovely. The Archon spared us the hassle of digging his grave.
We're placing considerable hope in this drill.
The very ground cracks open before us.
My favorite kind of fireworks!
How cute. The cowardly slug actually thinks his shield will stop us.
I see the Archon has a taste for inflicting torment. Perhaps we can trade some pointers.
Incredible. If the view's this impressive from the ground, imagine gazing out from the top.
I'm fine, master. Makeb's more volatile than I thought.
A few moments with this view, and I could almost forget about the war.
They know we're here, master. No turning back now.
The mesa's cut off. I hope nobody's foolish enough to try and land here.
Reminds me of the noble houses on Alderaan. Extravagance this grand often hides the corruption within.
Master, those hovertanks will destroy the civilians! Time to level the playing field.
At last, the civilians are free to revolt.
Be careful, master. There may be civilians within.
The molten blood of Makeb runs thick. We must be getting close.
The stronghold lies before us. The isotope-5 is almost ours!
No machine, not even one powered by isotope-5, can stand against the Force.
Makeb's core beckons us, master.
The miners cut Makeb to the bone.
Careful, master. One strong gust and we could be swept into oblivion.
Makeb's convulsions grow more violent. Hopefully, these wounds will heal in time.
A quick end to a deadly enemy.
Self-defense appears to be an obsession among the Hutts.
Residual pain floods this room, master.
There she is. Must be a few dozen kilometers tall. Too bad we're not here to demolish it.
Aftershocks. Natural tremors. Best to keep moving.
Prime sniper spot. Sun to your back and kilometers of unsuspecting targets. View's not bad either.
Ship this size will light up the sky when we take it down.
Not bad for improvised explosives. Next time, unleash military-grade ordnance, crater the whole landing pad.
Target's likely holed up inside. Estate this size is going to have some heavy defenses.
Once trained in a hovertank. Too slow for my taste, but they pulverize enemy lines like nothing else.
Seen hovertanks bombarded, never ripped apart up close. Didn't know what I was missing.
Lurker's in the cantina. Once we deal with him, drinks are on me.
Don't see this on Makeb's tourist vids.
Heard stories about light bridges shutting down. One second they're on, the next... forget I said anything.
Let's see how powerful isotope-5 really is.
Power online. Turbolift active. To the core!
Fifty megatonnes of high-yield explosives couldn't carve a shaft that deep.
Drill laser this size cuts through kilometers of rock. Shame we can't fire it at the Republic.
Aftermath of a major groundquake. Watch out for aftershocks.
Bull's-eye! You're a natural, my lord.
The Archon's entrenched. Nothing we can't handle.
Rooms like this are a soldier's nightmare. Better to die on the battlefield.
Impressive. Perfectly suited to our base of operations.
Careful, my lord. Perhaps we should move to safer ground.
From this vantage point, we can monitor Makeb for kilometers.
Our intrusion's been detected, my lord. Blocking comm traffic until we neutralize the spy vessel.
Crude but effective, my lord. It will take weeks to clear the wreckage and complete repairs.
Solida Hesk enjoys a life of excess. If she wishes to retain these pleasures, she had best cooperate.
Class-seven hovertanks, my lord. Few vulnerabilities outside of a close-quarters assault.
A sound victory, my lord. With the hovertanks routed, rebellion is imminent.
Be wary, my lord. We mustn't rule out an ambush.
My lord, temperatures are spiking. To avoid combustion, I'd advise against straying close to the molten streams.
Fascinating technology, light bridges. Most other structures would melt from the extreme heat.
Impressive construction, but all prototypes have a weakness.
Power is restored, my lord. The turbolift awaits.
The mine shaft. They must have worked for years to breach the planetary core.
The power capacity of such a drill must be staggering.
A groundquake swallowed the road whole. We'd best watch our step.
Impeccable shot, my lord.
The Archon's defenses are many, but they will fall.
Hutts know only terrible methods of extracting information.
So that's a gravity lift. Not bad. Don't tell me we have to climb that thing.
Whoa, there. That was a close one.
Wow. Looks just like the tourist vids. From the mesa peaks to the... oh, dizzy. Don't look down.
Great. They spotted us. Let's sink this ship and scram--you know, before all the explosions.
Sheesh! Hope the sabotage was worth it. Think I singed a lekku.
Snazzy. Bet Solida Hesk's got some priceless trinkets locked inside. Think she'll mind if I grab a few mementos?
Hovertanks? Seriously? These mercs aren't messing around.
Those hovertanks weren't so tough.
Ritzy cantina. Smart hideout, but I bet the drinks cost a fortune.
Phew, nice sauna. Wonder how much weight a Hutt would lose locked down here.
Stay calm, Vette. One foot in front of the other. It's not like there's a giant lake of fire right below you!
Call it a hunch, but that droid doesn't look friendly.
Let's hope that didn't wake any more of those beasties.
Look at that. Almost as bottomless as a Hutt stomach.
Aw, the mine looks so tiny from up here!
Something tells me this mesa is on its last legs.
Boom! Take that, evil mercenary guy!
Ooh, a force field. Somebody's scared of us.
Great. A Hutt interrogation chamber. Now I'm going to have nightmares.
It's a good thing we aren't required to climb that thing. We won't have to climb it, will we? Master?
Master, it may please you to note I was unaffected by the groundquake. I hope it pleases you. How may I please you?
The people down there seem so very small. This must be how you feel all the time, master!
Master, do you plan to replace your starship with this vessel? I assure you my duties will be unaffected.
Odds of salvage: extremely low. Your capacity for destruction is unrivaled!
Perhaps one day I'll have the pleasure of waiting upon you in such a place. If only I were capable of dreaming, master.
Is that a good example of "bristling with armaments," master?
Master, your capacity for destruction chills me into providing even better service.
Perhaps I should restock the ship's galley from this cantina, master. I shall remain vigilant for your potable preferences!
Master, perhaps I should take the lead? If I begin to melt, you shall know to turn back.
I never realized "heart of the volcano" was more than an expression, master.
Master! Please note that this droid and I don't share the same manufacturer!
The generator is operating with eighty-seven-point-nine-nine-one percent efficiency, master!
Take caution, master! I'm detecting yet another opportunity for a fatal fall!
Master, I'm programmed to recognize that this is an amazing view.
Take care, master. The ground is somewhat perforated.
Take that! I mean, excellent shot, master.
Those shields are only slightly less intimidating than you, master.
Oh, no. If I have done something to displease you, punishment is unnecessary.... My apologies, master. I misunderstood the situation.
I always appreciate the opportunity to restock the ship's stores. We are headed past the market, aren't we, Master?
Perhaps we should not stray so close to the edge, Master?
Forgive me, Master. The pollen here is affecting my vocabulator.
How very rude!
I suppose locals consider this to be art, master. Discerning tastes such as ours know otherwise.
The latest city maps don't include this massive trench, Master. I shall notify the cartographers at the next available opportunity.
One day, I shall serve on such a magnificent vessel. Not to imply any current dissatisfaction, Master.
Master, the ark is safe from an assault from here. I admit to unexpected levels of satisfaction in preventing its destruction.
I have absolutely no qualms about destroying a droid army, Master. I'll deactivate the light bridge myself, if you wish!
The complete lack of safety railings speaks to the Regulators' character, wouldn't you agree, Master?
That droid is broadcasting "destroy all enemies" on a loop, Master. I suspect he means you.
It feels good to be surrounded by walls again, Master, no matter how temporary.
Wonderful news, Master! None of the local wildlife can fully digest me.
The beasts should pay you no attention, Master. I've treated your armor with a dissuading agent that is reportedly quite pungent.
Master, I'm not sure whether to marvel at the efficiency or shudder at all this waste.
How does Toborro live out of so many towers, Master? Hundreds of turbolift repair technicians, perhaps?
It's true what the say about Hutts, Master. Extravagance is the bare minimum.
By the Maker! With these rods, the ark shall fly! What a sight it shall be, Master!
Master, above us! That vessel is impressively monstrous.
This building comprises the entire cultural history of Makeb. Funny. You'd think it would be bigger.
Elegant design, but this structure is highly defensible. Those walls are reinforced, and I spot three hidden weapon systems.
Ready to move in, on your mark. I'm almost nervous to break anything.
There are shielded energy sources inside the walls. I expect they power droids and heavy defenses.
Crude shells of technology, to be cracked and devoured like eggs.
The mercenary forces had every advantage. They miscalculated. Unfortunate.
Detecting multiple life-forms inside. Minimal armaments. We may proceed.
Adjusting internal cooling systems. Perhaps you should do the same.
The Stronghold vaults are shielded. I cannot detect the isotope-5 from here... but I am curious.
Its artificial intelligence is primitive. I have designed more advanced microorganisms. But its energy is beautiful.
Power engaged. We should be able to proceed to the core.
I have taken measures to preserve my core program. If we are buried here, I will survive.
When the Hutts came, a family took refuge here. I can hear a child's recorded distress signal. They were all taken by the mercenaries.
I have never personally witnessed extensive groundquake damage before. I enjoy deriving the equations; they are crude, but intricate.
The pilot is dead. Downloading flight log. You may proceed to destroy another.
The atmospheric charges have isolated me from galactic communications. Kill the Archon quickly, or I will take additional measures.
There are unusual chemical compounds in the air. The Archon formulates his interrogation serums precisely.
Those hovertanks are up to military specifications. Makeb really did fund its mercenaries well.
Target destroyed. Would it be wrong to take a souvenir? Not everyone gets to destroy a hovertank on foot.
Lurker should be inside. Looks like a cantina--must have been abandoned after the Hutts took over.
I don't often get nostalgic for Hoth, but there are moments. Shall we proceed?
Stronghold One ahead. Weapons charged. We'll find the isotope-5, sir--one way or another.
Tactical assessment--well, no one's ever fought a thing like this before, so your guess is as good as mine.
We've got power. Let's hope the lifts are working right--it's a long way to fall.
Look at it... is every planet like this on the inside?
Not a very defensible position for a base. Let's hope the Hutts don't find it.
These people on Makeb... look at what they've been through. No one deserves this, or the Hutts.
Target destroyed. I trained on surface-to-air missiles with the Chiss... never perfected it.
We've got a lot of ground to cover and enemies everywhere. Let's find our people.
If the Archon interrogated our people... that was our team. They were our responsibility.
Hovertanks: brutally slow and unmaneuverable, best used to intimidate. Just remember to duck when they start shooting.
Not the most delicate mission we've ever accomplished--but I think congratulations are in order.
If this is the Lurker's safe house, he must have been desperate indeed. Keep one hand on your weapon.
I knew a good man who died in the magma caverns of Saleucami. Dehydration. Sweating to death is not a pleasant end.
Stronghold One lives up to its name. And I was worried we'd been in for a disappointment.
I'm not a cyberneticist, but even I know that droid's not running on standard power cells. Isotope-5 is no myth.
We're lucky this equipment even works. You can almost smell the rust.
There's something exhilarating about pushing the boundaries of science. A whole planet, ready to destroy itself... we'll go down in history, one way or another.
Not a bad place for a picnic lunch--at least until the groundquakes send this whole structure tumbling.
I've seen planets bombarded by meteors that suffered less damage than this. It makes you wonder if we could destabilize cores on purpose.
Marvelous shooting--although the Regulators might disagree.
I heard rumors about a Hutt spymaster a long time ago. I never thought I'd be standing at his front door--but there are questions I'd like answered.
Look at the lighting, look at the tools--the Archon isn't brutal. He extracts information with an interrogator's precision.
Nice ride. Get one for me, and I promise to show you a real good time.
A swarm of insects can kill the largest bantha--but most banthas don't carry heavy weapons. We should be careful.
Now who's scary? Who's got the biggest gun now? Yeah, you heard me.
That should be enough. Let's hope the people of the settlements are grateful.
Our quarry should be inside. Let's hope we're the first to find him.
First cantina we find, and it's a mess. Freaking tragedy.
Now we know why security is minimal from this direction. Watch your step, for both our sakes.
I hate it hot. Let's finish up in here and get out.
Let's bust down the door and rob the place. You get the isotope, I'll get the cash.
This is why we came to Makeb. If our intelligence is correct, the isotope-5 is somewhere inside.
Mean looking. Give me a locked room and a steel pipe, and I'll bet you twenty credits I can take it.
That must be the Hutts' prototype. We're ready when you are.
Better than jumping, I guess. Looks like we've got power.
Those creatures... how many will be lost if Makeb is destroyed? Strange to think.
You could put anything down there and no one would ever find it. No one would ever find us, either.
This is the beating heart of a dying world. Listen to it. We must do right by Makeb.
What do you think? If the Hutts rush us, we can always jump for it.
The people of Makeb could have destroyed the beauty of their world. Instead, they built things like this.
Bad enough quake will rip apart anything. It's no fun when you can't do much about it.
Careful. If there's another groundquake, we'll be swallowed whole.
Ha! Look at that thing go down--didn't know what hit him.
Enemy fighter down. A pity it's come to this.
Chaos, but there are dangers here. The Archon is prepared for us.
You know, I'm looking forward to this. It's been way too long since I shot a Hutt.
Nice setup. I don't think your team made it.
These are instruments of pain and interrogation. What has the Archon done?
